resources.string: You will see digits on the screen, and your task is to click each digit as soon as it appears, but to withhold your response when the digit is the number 3. We know that people daydream. Every now and then, you will be asked about your thoughts just prior to the prompt. Please respond to those as accurately as possible.

I hereby consent to be a participant in the research performed by Dr. Marieke van Vugt. I have agreed to take part in the study entitled "thoughts in daily life" and I understand that my participation is entirely voluntary. I understand that my responses will be kept strictly confidential and anonymous. I have the option to withdraw from this study at any time, without penalty, and I also have the right to request that my responses not be used. The goal of this study is to better understand how cognitive function changes in the course of daily life. 

Participation in this study will help us to bridge between laboratory studies of cognitive function and cognition during daily life. I shall be asked to make judgments about numbers and other stimuli, and answer questions about my thoughts during the task. Each of the games will last a few minutes, and I will be asked to participate in these games daily for a period of a few weeks. 

My responses will be treated confidentially and my anonymity will be ensured. Hence, my responses cannot be identifiable and linked back to me as an individual.
What was the valence of your recent thought?

Wander is a cognitive sensing app created by Team Wan, a team of Computing Science students at the University of Groningen in the Netherlands. The application was created in partnership with Marieke van Vugt, an Assistant Professor in the Cognitive Modelling Group at the University of Groningen. \n\n With this app, the Cognitive Modelling Group would like to learn more about how the human mind works, and how its ability to perform changes over time. Moreover, we want to give you, the user, insight into your own brain as well. By using this app, and consenting to having your anonymous game data sent to us, you are contributing to real research into how the human mind works.

string-array.name: Questions
string-array.item: What were you just thinking about?
How difficult was it to disengage from the thought?
What was the valence of your recent thought?

string-array.name: Q1Answers
string-array.item: I was completely focused on the task.
I was evaluating aspects of the task. (For example my performance or how long it is taking)
I was thinking about personal matters.
I was distracted by my environment. (For example sound, temperature, my physical state)
I was daydreaming / I was thinking of task-unrelated matters.
I was not paying attention, but neither was I thinking about anything specifically.
